## statConfR: Dynamic Models for Confidence and Response Time Distributions

Provides fitting functions and other tools for decision confidence and metacognition researchers, including meta-d´/d´ ([Maniscalco and Lau, 2012](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1053810011002303)), often considered to be the gold standard to measure metacognitive efficiency. Also allows to fit several static models of decision making and confidence to test the assumptions underlying meta-d´/d´ and which may serve as an alternative when the assumptions of meta-d´/d´ do not hold [(see Rausch et al., 2023)](https://psyarxiv.com/kdz34/).<br />
**Authors**: Manuel Rausch, 	[Sebastian Hellmann](https://www.ku.de/ppf/psychologie/psychologie2/mitarbeitende/hellmann)<br />
**Maintainer**: Manuel Rausch<br />
**Bug Reports**:	<https://github.com/ManuelRausch/StatConfR/issues>

## dynConfiR: Dynamic Models for Confidence and Response Time Distributions

Provides density functions for the joint distribution of choice, response time and confidence for discrete confidence judgments as well as functions for parameter fitting, prediction and simulation for various dynamical models of decision confidence. See [Hellmann et al. (2023)](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/359571746_Simultaneous_modeling_of_choice_confidence_and_response_time_in_visual_perception){target="_blank"} for model details.<br /> 
**Authors**:	[Sebastian Hellmann](https://www.ku.de/ppf/psychologie/psychologie2/mitarbeitende/hellmann), Manuel Rausch<br />
**Maintainer**:	[Sebastian Hellmann](https://www.ku.de/ppf/psychologie/psychologie2/mitarbeitende/hellmann)<br />
**Bug Reports**:	<https://github.com/SeHellmann/dynConfiR/issues>
